economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over payment for herdsman services (witness 19: asked for 15 'paires' but only entitled to 14.5); dispute over meadow lease withdrawn by Jean Florentin; dispute over payment for dead ass (witness 18, 25); dispute over pears from common tree (witness 8); trespassing incidents on fields. Claudon's parents described as 'gens mendiants et vagabonds' indicating very poor economic origins. He worked as herdsman for 8 years and left position when wife became ill, showing economic vulnerability.

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a rich trial record with extensive witness testimony. Key uncertainties: (1) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on parents described as 'mendiants et vagabonds' and his role as herdsman, though he employed others during harvest suggesting some resources. (2) Multiple healing practices documented with specific prayer references to Delcambre's catalog. (3) Confession extracted under torture and retracted, then renewed after private conversation with bourgeois La Verdure - this sequence is unusual and significant. (4) No explicit mention of Change de Nancy consultation despite qualified lawyers being consulted. (5) Extensive testimony about supernatural wolf behavior is notable - wolves that circle and scratch rather than attack, suggesting community belief in shape-shifting. (6) Trial date for denunciation by Estienne Chauffel is 19 June 1608; informations preparatoires began end June/early July, suggesting rapid progression. (7) Several witnesses are married couples testifying to same events, creating corroboration networks. (8) Total of 23+ alleged harms cataloged, predominantly animal deaths with several human illness cases including children.
